devdoc.details: Shows how to use mappings to store and retrieve data efficiently

dataSetter(uint256,uint256,string).details: Sets student data in the mappingGas cost: ~40,000-60,000 (higher due to struct storage)

params.class: The class/grade the student is in
params.name: The student's name

getRollNo(uint256).details: Gets a value from the roll_no mapping

returns._0: The string value associated with the key, or empty string if not set

getStudentData(uint256).details: Gets student data from the mapping

returns._0: The class and name of the student

keyExists(uint256).details: Checks if a key exists in the roll_no mappingNote: There's no direct way to check if a key exists - we check if the value is empty

returns._0: true if the key has a non-empty value, false otherwise

removeKey(uint256).details: Removes a key-value pair from the roll_no mappingNote: The key still exists in the mapping but maps to an empty value

setter(uint256,string).details: Sets a value in the roll_no mappingGas cost: ~20,000-40,000 (varies based on storage operations)

params._key: The uint256 key (e.g., student roll number)
params._value: The string value to associate with the key (e.g., student name)

updateStudentClass(uint256,uint256).details: Updates the class of an existing studentRequires the student to already exist in the mapping

updateStudentName(uint256,string).details: Updates the name of an existing student

data.details: Mapping from uint keys to Student struct values

roll_no.details: Mapping from uint256 keys to string valuesStorage Characteristics: - Doesn't occupy storage slots for unused keys - Keys are hashed to find the storage location - No length or way to enumerate keys - Very gas efficient for access (O(1) complexity)

devdoc.title: Mapping Demonstration in Solidity

data(uint256).notice: Demonstrates using complex types (structs) as mapping valuesPublic visibility creates a getter that returns the entire struct

dataSetter(uint256,uint256,string).notice: Shows how to store struct values in a mapping

getRollNo(uint256).notice: Explicit getter function (though public mapping already provides one)

getStudentData(uint256).notice: Shows how to retrieve struct data from a mapping

keyExists(uint256).notice: Demonstrates how to check for key existence

removeKey(uint256).notice: Sets the value to empty string, effectively removing the mapping entry

roll_no(uint256).notice: Public visibility automatically creates a getter functionExample use case: mapping student roll numbers (keys) to student names (values)Keys are unique - setting a key twice overwrites the previous value

setter(uint256,string).notice: Demonstrates how to store values in a mapping

updateStudentClass(uint256,uint256).notice: Shows how to update specific fields in a struct stored in a mapping

updateStudentName(uint256,string).notice: Shows how to update specific fields in a struct stored in a mapping

userdoc.notice: Mappings are key-value stores where keys map to valuesAnalogous to hash tables or dictionaries in other languagesAll mappings in Solidity are virtual - they don't store all keys, just the ones that have been set
